contentrichtext.text: {{Infobox musical artist | image = | name = Nour Mhanna | background = solo_singer | origin = [[Aleppo]], [[Syria]] | genre = [[Music of Syria|Syrian]], [[Arabic Music]] | occupation = [[Singer]] | years_active = | website = }} '''Nour Mhanna''' (''Nur Mahana'') is a [[Syria]]n singer. Mhanna started his musical career as a reciter of the [[Qur'an]], before switching to secular music. On 1 July 2004 he performed at the Sycuan Resort and Casino in [[El Cajon, California]].<ref>{{cite web| url = http://www.anthemartists.com/AA_show_archives.html| title = Archive of Past Shows Presented & Produced by Anthem Artists| accessdate = 2007-05-27| publisher = Anthem Artists|archiveurl = http://web.archive.org/web/20070409103921/http://www.anthemartists.com/AA_show_archives.html <!-- Bot retrieved archive --> |archivedate = 2007-04-09}}</ref> He and his backup band traveled there on [[Northwest Airlines Flight 327]], where their behaviour lead to suspicions that they were a [[Dry run (terrorism)|dry run]] for a future possible terrorist attack.<ref> {{cite web | url = http://www.nationalreview.com/comment/taylor200407211921.asp | title = The Syrian Wayne Newton | accessdate = 2007-05-27 | date = 2004-07-21 | publisher = National Review Online | author = Clinton W. Taylor }} </ref> ==External links== * [http://www.orientaltunes.com/listening_page9.html#Nour Oriental Tunes] ==Notes== <references /> {{Persondata <!-- Metadata: see [[Wikipedia:Persondata]]. --> | NAME =Mhanna, Nour | ALTERNATIVE NAMES = | SHORT DESCRIPTION = | DATE OF BIRTH = | PLACE OF BIRTH = | DATE OF DEATH = | PLACE OF DEATH = }} {{DEFAULTSORT:Mhanna, Nour}} [[Category:Living people]] [[Category:Syrian Muslims]] [[Category:Syrian male singers]] [[Category:People from Aleppo]] {{syria-bio-stub}}
